page.title: 06SHETLAND TIMES 24TH MAY 1985
page.content: A BURRA BOAT CALLED THE ACHIEVE WAS THE FIRST SHETLAND TRAWLER TO BRING BACK A CATCH FROM ROCKALL WHICH IS A RETURNED TRIP OF 840 MILES.THEY CAUGHT 900 BOXES OF HADDOCK WHICH FETCHED Â£21 A BOX, A DISAPPOINTING PRICE. ON 18TH MAY A NEW BOAT CALLED "SCOTTIE'S PRIDE", WAS LAUNCHED BY COLLEEN CHRISTIE.HER FATHER AND 82 YEAR OLD GRANDFATHER BUILT IT OVER THE LAST TWO YEARS. FOUR LEADERS ON THE FIRST GUIDE LEADERS TRAINING COURSE IN SHETLAND WERE FROM BURRA. THERE WAS A BONNIE BABY CONTEST HELD AT THE EVENTIDE HOME AND THE WINNER OF THE O-6 MONTH AGE GROUP WAS FROM BRIDGE END. FOUR BURRA MEN HAVE BEEN IN THE SCALLOWAY LEGION A DARTS TEAM, WHO HAVE BEEN LEAGUE CHAMPIONS FOR 3 YEARS
